Item.Name: ObjectInstanceHandle
Item.Description: The object link is used to refer an Instance of a given Object. An Object link value is composed of two concatenated 16-bit unsigned integers following the Network Byte Order convention. The Most Significant Halfword is an Object ID, the Least Significant Halfword is an Object Instance ID. An Object Link referencing no Object Instance will contain the concatenation of 2 MAX-ID values.

Item.Name: ObjectVersion
Item.Description: LWM2M Object versioning label.

Item.Name: LogClass
Item.Description: Define the Log Event Class: 0: generic (default) 1: system 2: security 3: event 4: trace 5: panic 6: charging [7-99]: reserved [100-255]: vendor specific

Item.Name: LogStart
Item.Description: Actions:a) Start data collection(DC)b) LogStatus is set to 0 (running)c) DC is emptied (default) or extended according arg'0' value Arguments definitions are described in the table below.

Item.Name: LogStop
Item.Description: Actions: a) Stop data collection(DC) b) 1st LSB of LogStatus is set to "1"(stopped) c) DC is kept (default) or emptied according arg'0' value Arguments definitions are described in the table below.

Item.Name: LogStatus
Item.Description: Data Collection process status: Each bit of this Resource Instance value defines specific status: 1st LSB 0=running, 1=stopped 2nd LSB 1=LogData contains Valid Data 0=LogData doesnâ€™t contain Valid Data 3rd LSB 1=Error occurred during Data Collection 0=No error [4th -7th ] LSB:reserved 8th LSB: vendor specific.

Item.Name: LogData
Item.Description: Read Access on that Resource returns the Data Collection associated to the current Object Instance.

Item.Name: LogDataFormat
Item.Description: when set by the Server, this Resource indicates to the Client, what is the Server preferred data format to use when the LogData Resource is returned. when retrieved by the Server, this Resource indicates which specific data format is used when the LogData Resource is returned to the Server 0 or Resource not present : no specific data format (sequence of bytes)1 : OMA-LwM2M TLV format2 : OMA-LwM2M JSON format3: OMA-LwM2M CBOR format[4..99] reserved [100..255] vendor specific data format

Item.Name: Digital Input State
Item.Description: The current state of a digital input.

Item.Name: Digital Input Counter
Item.Description: The cumulative value of active state detected.

Item.Name: Digital Input Polarity
Item.Description: The polarity of the digital input as a Boolean (False = Normal, True = Reversed).

Item.Name: Digital Input Debounce
Item.Description: The debounce period in ms.

Item.Name: Digital Input Edge Selection
Item.Description: The edge selection as an integer (1 = Falling edge, 2 = Rising edge, 3 = Both Rising and Falling edge).

Item.Name: Digital Input Counter Reset
Item.Description: Reset the Counter value.

Item.Name: Current Time
Item.Description: Unix Time. A signed integer representing the number of seconds since Jan 1st, 1970 in the UTC time zone.

Item.Name: Fractional Time
Item.Description: Fractional part of the time when sub-second precision is used (e.g., 0.23 for 230 ms).

Item.Name: Min X Value
Item.Description: The minimum measured value along the X axis expressed in the unit defined by the "Sensor Units" resource if present.

Item.Name: Max X Value
Item.Description: The maximum measured value along the X axis expressed in the unit defined by the "Sensor Units" resource if present.

Item.Name: Min Y Value
Item.Description: The minimum measured value along the Y axis expressed in the unit defined by the "Sensor Units" resource if present.

Item.Name: Max Y Value
Item.Description: The maximum measured value along the Y axis expressed in the unit defined by the "Sensor Units" resource if present.

Item.Name: Min Z Value
Item.Description: The minimum measured value along the Z axis expressed in the unit defined by the "Sensor Units" resource if present.

Item.Name: Max Z Value
Item.Description: The maximum measured value along the Z axis expressed in the unit defined by the "Sensor Units" resource if present.

Item.Name: Latitude
Item.Description: The decimal notation of latitude, e.g. -43.5723 (World Geodetic System 1984).

Item.Name: Longitude
Item.Description: The decimal notation of longitude, e.g. 153.21760 (World Geodetic System 1984).

Item.Name: Uncertainty
Item.Description: The accuracy of the position in meters.

Item.Name: Velocity
Item.Description: The velocity of the device as defined in 3GPP 23.032 GAD specification. This set of values may not be available if the device is static.

Item.Name: Timestamp
Item.Description: The timestamp of when the measurement was performed.

Item.Name: Min Limit
Item.Description: The minimum value that can be measured by the sensor.

Item.Name: Max Limit
Item.Description: The maximum value that can be measured by the sensor.

Item.Name: Delay Duration
Item.Description: The duration of the time delay.

Item.Name: Clip
Item.Description: Audio clip that is playable (e.g., a short audio recording indicating the floor in an elevator).

Item.Name: Trigger
Item.Description: Trigger initiating actuation.

Item.Name: Duration
Item.Description: The duration of the sound once trigger.

Item.Name: Minimum Off-time
Item.Description: The off time when On/Off control remains on.

Item.Name: Timer Mode
Item.Description: Type of timer pattern used by the timer. 1: One-shot, 2: On-Time or Interval, 3: Time delay on pick-up, 4: Time Delay on Drop-Out, 0: disables the timer.

Item.Name: Text
Item.Description: A string of text.

Item.Name: X Coordinate
Item.Description: X Coordinate.

Item.Name: Y Coordinate
Item.Description: Y Coordinate.

Item.Name: Clear Display
Item.Description: Command to clear the display.

Item.Name: Contrast
Item.Description: Proportional control, integer value between 0 and 100 as a percentage.

Item.Name: Increase Input State
Item.Description: Indicates an increase control action.

Item.Name: Decrease Input State
Item.Description: Indicates a decrease control action.

Item.Name: Counter
Item.Description: Counts the number of times the timer output transitions from 0 to 1.

Item.Name: Calibration Offset
Item.Description: Calibration offset value to be used to additively correct the measured value of the sensor.

Item.Name: Current Position
Item.Description: Current position or desired position of a positioner actuator.

Item.Name: Transition Time
Item.Description: The time expected to move the actuator to the new position.

Item.Name: Remaining Time
Item.Description: The time remaining in an operation.

Item.Name: Up Counter
Item.Description: Counts the number of times the increase control has been operated. Writing a 0 resets the counter.

Item.Name: Down Counter
Item.Description: Counts the times the decrease control has been operated. Writing a 0 resets the counter.

Item.Name: Digital State
Item.Description: The current state of the timer output.

Item.Name: Cumulative Time
Item.Description: The total time in seconds that the timer input is true. Writing a 0 resets the time.

Item.Name: Max X Coordinate
Item.Description: The highest X coordinate the display supports before wrapping to the next line.

Item.Name: Max Y Coordinate
Item.Description: The highest Y coordinate the display supports before wrapping to the next line.

Item.Name: Multi-state Input
Item.Description: The current state of a Multi-state input or selector.

Item.Name: Level
Item.Description: Used to represent a level control such as audio volume.

Item.Name: Digital Output State
Item.Description: The current state of a digital output.

Item.Name: Digital Output Polarity
Item.Description: The polarity of the digital output as a Boolean (False = Normal, True = Reversed).

Item.Name: Analog Input Current Value
Item.Description: The current value of the analog input.

Item.Name: Min Measured Value
Item.Description: The minimum value measured by the sensor since it is ON or Reset, expressed in the unit defined by the "Sensor Units" resource if present.

Item.Name: Max Measured Value
Item.Description: The maximum value measured by the sensor since it is ON or Reset, expressed in the unit defined by the "Sensor Units" resource if present.

Item.Name: Min Range Value
Item.Description: The minimum value that can be measured by the sensor, expressed in the unit defined by the "Sensor Units" resource if present.

Item.Name: Max Range Value
Item.Description: The maximum value that can be measured by the sensor, expressed in the unit defined by the "Sensor Units" resource if present.

Item.Name: Reset Min and Max Measured Values
Item.Description: Reset the Min and Max Measured Values to current value.

Item.Name: Analog Output Current Value
Item.Description: The current value of the analog output.

Item.Name: Sensor Value
Item.Description: Last or Current Measured Value from the Sensor expressed in the unit defined by the "Sensor Units" resource if present.

Item.Name: Sensor Units
Item.Description: Measurement Units Definition.

Item.Name: X Value
Item.Description: The measured value along the X axis expressed in the unit defined by the "Sensor Units" resource if present.

Item.Name: Y Value
Item.Description: The measured value along the Y axis expressed in the unit defined by the "Sensor Units" resource if present.

Item.Name: Z Value
Item.Description: The measured value along the Z axis expressed in the unit defined by the "Sensor Units" resource if present.

Item.Name: Compass Direction
Item.Description: The measured compass direction.

Item.Name: Colour
Item.Description: A string representing a value in the color space defined by the "Sensor Units" resource if present.

Item.Name: Application Type
Item.Description: The application type of the sensor or actuator as a string, for instance "Air Pressure".

Item.Name: Sensor Type
Item.Description: The type of the sensor (for instance PIR type).

Item.Name: Instantaneous active power
Item.Description: The current active power.

Item.Name: Min Measured active power
Item.Description: The minimum active power measured by the sensor since it is ON.

Item.Name: Max Measured active power
Item.Description: The maximum active power measured by the sensor since it is ON.

Item.Name: Min Range active power
Item.Description: The minimum active power that can be measured by the sensor.

Item.Name: Max Range active power
Item.Description: The maximum active power that can be measured by the sensor.

Item.Name: Cumulative active power
Item.Description: The cumulative active power since the last cumulative energy reset or device start.

Item.Name: Active Power Calibration
Item.Description: Request an active power calibration by writing the value of a calibrated load.

Item.Name: Instantaneous reactive power
Item.Description: The current reactive power.

Item.Name: Min Measured reactive power
Item.Description: The minimum reactive power measured by the sensor since it is ON.

Item.Name: Max Measured reactive power
Item.Description: The maximum reactive power measured by the sensor since it is ON.

Item.Name: Min Range reactive power
Item.Description: The minimum active power that can be measured by the sensor.

Item.Name: Max Range reactive power
Item.Description: The maximum reactive power that can be measured by the sensor.

Item.Name: Cumulative reactive power
Item.Description: The cumulative reactive power since the last cumulative energy reset or device start.

Item.Name: Reactive Power Calibration
Item.Description: Request a reactive power calibration by writing the value of a calibrated load.

Item.Name: Power factor
Item.Description: If applicable, the power factor of the current consumption.

Item.Name: Current Calibration
Item.Description: Read or Write the current calibration coefficient.

Item.Name: Reset Cumulative energy
Item.Description: Reset both cumulative active/reactive power.

Item.Name: Event Identifier
Item.Description: The event identifier as a string.

Item.Name: Start Time
Item.Description: Time when the event started.

Item.Name: Duration In Min
Item.Description: The duration of the event in minutes.

Item.Name: Criticality Level
Item.Description: The criticality of the event. The device receiving the event will react in an appropriate fashion for the device.

Item.Name: Avg Load AdjPct
Item.Description: Defines the maximum energy usage of the receiving device, as a percentage of the device's normal maximum energy usage.

Item.Name: Duty Cycle
Item.Description: Defines the duty cycle for the load control event, i.e, what percentage of time the receiving device is allowed to be on.

Item.Name: On/Off
Item.Description: On/off control. Boolean value where True is On and False is Off.

Item.Name: Dimmer
Item.Description: This resource represents a light dimmer setting, which has an Integer value between 0 and 100 as a percentage.

Item.Name: On time
Item.Description: The time in seconds that the device has been turned on. Writing a value of 0 resets the counter.

Item.Name: Muti-state Output
Item.Description: A string describing a state for multiple level output such as Pilot Wire.

Item.Name: Off Time
Item.Description: The time in seconds since the Off command was sent. Writing a value of 0 resets the counter.

Item.Name: Set Point Value
Item.Description: The setpoint value expressed in the unit defined by the "Sensor Units" resource if present.

Item.Name: Busy to Clear delay
Item.Description: Delay from the detection state to the clear state in ms.

Item.Name: Clear to Busy delay
Item.Description: Delay from the clear state to the busy state in ms.

Item.Name: Host Device Manufacturer
Item.Description: Human readable host device manufacturer name.

Item.Name: Host Device Model Number
Item.Description: A host device model identifier (manufacturer specified string).

Item.Name: Host Device Unique ID
Item.Description: The host device unique ID as assigned by an OEM, MNO, or other as the Device ID in the onboarding or manufacturing process.

Item.Name: Host Device Software Version
Item.Description: Current software version of the host device (manufacturer specified string).

Item.Name: Bitmap Input
Item.Description: Integer in which each of the bits are associated with specific digital input value. Represented as a binary signed integer in network byte order, and in two's complement representation. Using values in range 0-127 is recommended to avoid ambiguities with byte order and negative values.

Item.Name: Bitmap Input Reset
Item.Description: Reset the Bitmap Input value.

Item.Name: Element Description
Item.Description: The semantics / description of each bit as a string. First instance describes the least significant bit, second instance the second least significant bit, etc.

Item.Name: Interval Period
Item.Description: The Interval Period resource is an Integer value representing the width in seconds of the intervals being managed by this interval data object. This resource is read only and can only be changed by resource 11 (Change Interval Configuration). It is recommended that the Interval Period be set to a devisor of 24 hours (86400 seconds) to provide a consistent interval period. Examples of Interval Period include:- 30 = Every 30 seconds 600 = Every 10 minutes 1800 = Every 30 minutes 3600 = Hourly 7200 = Every 2 hours 14400 = Every 4 hours 43200 = Every 12 hours 86400 = Every Day 172600 = Every Second Day

Item.Name: Interval Start Offset
Item.Description: The Interval Start Offset resource is a read only resource representing the number of seconds past midnight for which the first interval is recorded. If this resource is empty, it is assumed that the intervals are midnight aligned. This can be used to adjust interval boundaries. As an example, an Interval Period of 3600 seconds and an Interval Start time of 300 represents hourly interval data, starting at 00:05.

Item.Name: Interval UTC Offset
Item.Description: The Interval UTC Offset resource is a read only resource representing the time zone offset for this Interval Data instance. If this resource is empty, the application should use the UTC offset provided in the Device [/3/0/14] object instance resource or UTC if not provided. UTC+X [ISO 8601].

Item.Name: Interval Collection Start Time
Item.Description: The Collection Start Time resource is a read only resource representing the time when the first interval was recorded on the device. Interval times represent the end of the interval, not the beginning. As an example, the first four hourly interval past midnight will have a timestamp of 04:00 (adjusting for UTC offset).

Item.Name: Oldest Recorded Interval
Item.Description: The Oldest Recorded Interval resource is a read-only resource representing the oldest available interval on the device. Interval times represent the end of the interval, not the beginning.

Item.Name: Last Delivered Interval
Item.Description: The Last Delivered Interval is a readable and writable resource used to represent the last interval delivered to the LwM2M server. Interval times represent the end of the interval, not the beginning. The setting of this resource is implementation specific but should be updated based on, either a Read request of the Latest Payload from the LwM2M server or via a confirmed delivery of Notify operation of the Latest Payload resource. This resource is writable to allow the server to adjust the Last Delivered Interval value if the server and client is out of sync.

Item.Name: Latest Recorded Interval
Item.Description: The Latest Recorded Interval is a readable resource representing the currently highest recorded interval on the device. Interval times represent the end of the interval, not the beginning.

Item.Name: Interval Delivery Midnight Aligned
Item.Description: The Delivery Midnight Aligned is a readable and writable resource used to indicate if data is delivered only to the previous midnight (1) or if part-day data can be delivered (0). Calculating Midnight should consider the Interval UTC Offset resource, or if empty, the Device [/3/0/14] object instance resource.

Item.Name: Interval Historical Read
Item.Description: Historical Interval Read is an executable resource designed to retrieve ad-hoc interval read data. The resource takes two arguments:- Argument 0: First Interval time to Retrieve represented as number of seconds since Jan 1st, 1970 in the UTC time zone. Argument 1: Last interval time to Retrieve represented as number of seconds since Jan 1st, 1970 in the UTC time zone. The dates should be inclusive based on the end time of the interval. The data retrieved from this resource will be readable (or observable) from the Historical Read Payload Resource. As an example, the Argument List to retrieve data from Midnight 2nd March (UTC+10) to Midnight 6rd March (UTC+10) for a specific instance of the interval data object, would be constructed as follows:- 0='1488463200',1='1488808800'

Item.Name: Interval Historical Read Payload
Item.Description: The Historical Read Payload resource is the representation of the data requested by the Historical Interval Read executable resource. The format of this Opaque value should be identical to the Latest Payload resource. If no Historical Interval Read has been executed, this resource should return and empty Opaque value. This resource can either be Read from the Server or set up as an observation and Notified to the server as soon as the historical data is available. When this payload is delivered to the LwM2M server, via either a read request or a confirmed observation on this Object, Object Instance or Resource, the Historical Read Payload should be set to an empty Opaque value.

Item.Name: Interval Change Configuration
Item.Description: Change Interval Configuration is an executable resource designed to allow the Interval Period, Interval Start Offset and Interval UTC Offset to be reconfigured. The resource takes three arguments:- Argument 0: [Mandatory] Interval Period represented as an integer as defined in the Interval Period Resource. Argument 1: [Optional] Interval start offset represented as an integer as defined in the Interval Start Offset Resource. If not provided, leave the value as per the current configuration Argument 2: [Optional] Interval UTC offset represented as a String as defined in the Interval UTC Offset Resource. If not provided, leave the value as per the current configuration. Depending on the specifics of the implementation of this object, reconfiguring the Interval data object may result in the removal of all historical data for this Interval Data Object Instance. Please consult with your device vendor as to the implications of reconfiguring an Interval Data Object Instance. As an example, the Argument List to change an interval data object instance from its existing values to one hour intervals, midnight aligned in UTC+10 time zone:- 0='3600',1='0',1='UTC+10'

Item.Name: Event Type
Item.Description: Event Type is a readable and writable resource used to represent how this event will behave. Event Type should be one of the following values:- 0. Disabled 1. Alarm Current State 2. Alarm State Change Log 3. Event Log When the Event Type is set to Disabled (0), this event will not be recorded by the device. No Latest Eventlog payload should be delivered for events that are Disabled. When the Event Type is set to Alarm Current State (1), this Event is treated as an alarm state manager and the Latest Eventlog Payload will only contain the current state of this alarm. When the Event Type is set to Alarm State Change Log (2), the Event is treated as an alarm that reports whenever the Alarm is either set or cleared. The Latest Eventlog Payload will contain all alarm transitions since the previous delivery in this mode. When the Event Type is set to Event Log (3), this object instance is treated as a raw event log. It is used to manage and deliver events. The Latest Eventlog Payload will contain all events since the previous delivery in this mode. See the Event Log Payload for examples of each of these modes.

Item.Name: Alarm Realtime
Item.Description: Realtime is a readable and writable resource used to indicate if an event should report immediately (1) at the point of occurrence, or delivered periodically as part of the Latest Eventlog Payload.

Item.Name: Alarm State
Item.Description: Alarm State is a read-only resource used to indicate the current alarm state for this Event configuration. This is only applicable if the Event Type is Alarm Current State (1) or Alarm State Change (2).

Item.Name: Alarm Set Threshold
Item.Description: Set Threshold is a readable and writable resource used to represent the threshold for when an alarm is triggered. This resource is used in conjunction with the Set Operator resource.

Item.Name: Alarm Set Operator
Item.Description: Set Operator is a readable and writable resource used in conjunction with the Set Threshold to represent when an alarm is triggered. This resource should be set to one of the following values:- 0. Greater Than or Equal to 1. Less Than or Equal to By setting the Set Operator to Greater Than (0), when the measured value for this event exceeds the Set Threshold resource, the event is considered to be in an Alarm State of 1 By setting the Set Operator to Less Than (1), when the measured value for this event falls below the Set Threshold resource, the event is considered to be in an Alarm State of 1

Item.Name: Alarm Clear Threshold
Item.Description: Clear Threshold is a readable and writable resource used to represent the threshold for when an alarm is cleared. This resource is used in conjunction with the Clear Operator resource.

Item.Name: Alarm Clear Operator
Item.Description: Clear Operator is a readable and writable resource used in conjunction with the Clear Threshold to represent when an alarm is Cleared. This resource should be set to one of the following values:- 0. Greater Than or Equal to 1. Less Than or Equal to By setting the Clear Operator to Greater Than (0), when the measured value for this event exceeds the Clear Threshold resource, the event is considered to be in an Alarm State of 0 By setting the Clear Operator to Less Than (1), when the measured value for this event falls below the Clear Threshold resource, the event is considered to be in an Alarm State of 0

Item.Name: Alarm Maximum Event Count
Item.Description: Maximum Event Count is a readable and writable resource used provide a ceiling on the number of events that can be raised within the time period defined in Maximum Event Period resource. If no Maximum Event Count is set, the number of events recorded is unconstrained. The intent of this resource is to control the number of events reported, particularly in the case of a faulty sensor.

Item.Name: Alarm Maximum Event Period
Item.Description: Maximum Event Period is a readable and writable resource used in conjunction with the Maximum Event Count resource to control the number of events that can be raised in a given period. Maximum Event Period is an integer value representing the number of seconds for which the Maximum Event Count is measured. If no Maximum Event Period is set, the number of events recorded is unconstrained. The intent of this resource is to control the number of events reported, particularly in the case of a faulty sensor.

Item.Name: Latest Delivered Event Time
Item.Description: Latest Delivered Event Time is a readable and writable resource to represent the last recorded time that an event was delivered for this event code to the LwM2M server. The setting of this resource is implementation specific but should be updated based on, either a Read request of the Latest Eventlog Payload from the LwM2M server or via a confirmed delivery of Notify operation of the Latest Eventlog Payload resource. This resource is writable to allow the server to adjust the Last Delivered Event Time value if the server and client is out of sync.

Item.Name: Latest Recorded Event Time
Item.Description: Latest Recorded Event Time is a readonly resource used to represent the last recorded event time for this object instance on the device

Item.Name: Alarm Clear
Item.Description: Clear Alarm is an executable resource used to allow the LwM2M server to clear alarms when they need to be manually acknowledged.

Item.Name: Alarm Auto Clear
Item.Description: Auto Clear Alarm is a readable and writable resource used to indicate if an alarm is automatically cleared once the delivery of the event data payload is complete

Item.Name: Event Code
Item.Description: Event Code is a read-only resource used as an identifier to represent this class of event. The allocation of event codes is implementation specific but ideally be unique across the implementation. Event Codes use vendor specific LogClass value 100...255

Item.Name: Latest Payload
Item.Description: The Latest Eventlog Payload resource is a read-only serialised Opaque (Binary) representation of all the Event Data between the Last Delivered Event Time and the Latest Recorded Event Time. When this payload is delivered to the LwM2M server, via either a read request or a confirmed observation on this Object, Object Instance or Resource, the Latest Delivered Interval should be updated. When no new data exists, an empty Opaque value should be provided. The payload data can be provided in an implementation specific serialisation, but by default for fixed length values should use the OMA-LwM2M CBOR format encoded with one of these schemes:- Event Type = Alarm Current State (1) In this mode, only the current alarm state should be reported 1. 8-bit integer, value 2 representing OMA-LwM2M CBOR format. 2. Event Code [16-bit integer] 3. Event Type [8-bit Integer] - Alarm Current State (1) 4. Alarm Timestamp [32-bit unsigned integer] representing the number of seconds since Jan 1st, 1970 in the UTC time zone. 5. Alarm State [8-bit Integer]

Item.Name: Start
Item.Description: Start is an executable resource that enables the recording of interval data. The first interval recorded will have a timestamp based on the Interval Start Offset resource. This executable resource takes no arguments. Refer to re-usable resource LogStart for further details.

Item.Name: Stop
Item.Description: Stop (LogStop) is an executable resource that disables the recording of interval data for this object instance. This executable resource takes no arguments. Refer to re-usable resource LogStop for further details.

Item.Name: Status
Item.Description: Recording Enabled is a read-only resource providing an indication of if interval data is currently being recorded for this object instance. Refer to re-usable resource LogStatus for further details.

Item.Name: Latest Payload
Item.Description: The Latest Payload resource is a read-only serialised Opaque (Binary) representation of all the Interval Data between the Last Delivered Interval and the Latest Recorded Interval, accounting for the Delivery Midnight Aligned resource. When this payload is delivered to the LwM2M server, via either a read request or a confirmed observation on this Object, Object Instance or Resource, the Latest Delivered Interval should be updated. When no new data exists, an empty Opaque value should be provided. The payload data can be provided in an implementation specific serialisation, but by default for fixed length values should use the OMA-LwM2M CBOR format encoded as follows: 1. 8-bit integer, value 2 representing OMA-LwM2M CBOR format. 2. Interval Data Instance ID/ Class [16-bit integer] 3. Timestamp of first Interval [32-bit integer] representing the number of seconds since Jan 1st, 1970 in the UTC time zone. 4. Interval Period in seconds [32-bit integer] 5. Number of intervals in Payload [16-bit integer] 6. Number of Values Per Interval [8-bit integer] 7. Size of Value 1 in bits [8-bit integer] 8. Size of Value 2 in bits [8-bit integer] ... 9. Size of Value N in bits [8-bit integer] 10. Interval 1 Value 1 [x bits] 11. Interval 1 Value 2 [x bits] ... 12. Interval 1 Value N [x bits] ... 13. Interval N Value N [x bits] If for some implementation specific reason, there are missing intervals in the sequence, the payload may consist of multiple blocks of the above serialised data (appended into a single binary opaque value), each block representing a continuous series of interval data.

Item.Name: plmnID
Item.Description: PLMN - mcc/mnc

Item.Name: BandIndicator
Item.Description: Band Indicator

Item.Name: dlEarfcn
Item.Description: EARFCN - frequency

Item.Name: CellID
Item.Description: Cell Identity

Item.Name: rsrp
Item.Description: RSRP Value in dBm (-180..-30)

Item.Name: rsrq
Item.Description: RSRQ Value in dB (-30..10)

Item.Name: sysFrameNumber
Item.Description: System Frame Number

Item.Name: subFrameNumber
Item.Description: Sub Frame Number

Item.Name: Altitude
Item.Description: Altitude above sea level in meters.

Item.Name: Sample Frequency
Item.Description: How often the inputs are read/sampled.This value can be changed by doing a write command

Item.Name: Sensor Warm-up Time
Item.Description: Warm-up (wait) time before sensor value is read

Item.Name: Measurement Quality Indicator
Item.Description: Measurement quality indicator reported by a smart sensor. 0: UNCHECKED No quality checks were done because they do not exist or can not be applied. 1: REJECTED WITH CERTAINTY The measured value is invalid. 2: REJECTED WITH PROPABILITY The measured value is likely invalid. 3: ACCEPTED BUT SUSPICIOUS The measured value is likely OK. 4: ACCEPTED The measured value is OK. 5-15: Reserved for future expansion. 16-23: Vendor specific measurement quality.

Item.Name: Measured Particle Size
Item.Description: Size of the particle that the sensor is measuring

Item.Name: Battery Percentage
Item.Description: Current remaining battery level.

Item.Name: RSSI
Item.Description: Received Signal Strength Indicator.

Item.Name: Smoke Sensor State
Item.Description: Indicate current smoke sensor state.

Item.Name: Detected CO2 percentage
Item.Description: Current level of detected CO2 as a percentage of concentration.

Item.Name: Alarm loudness
Item.Description: Indicate the loudness of the alarm.

Item.Name: Measurement Quality Level
Item.Description: Measurement quality level reported by a smart sensor. Quality level 100 means that the measurement has fully passed quality check algorithms. Smaller quality levels mean that quality has decreased and the measurement has only partially passed quality check algorithms. The smaller the quality level, the more caution should be used by the application when using the measurement. When the quality level is 0 it means that the measurement should certainly be rejected.

Item.Name: Fractional Timestamp
Item.Description: Fractional part of the timestamp when sub-second precision is used (e.g., 0.23 for 230 ms).
